title: [WIP]TESLA Configuration (Ticket Listview Support)  [ANDROID ONLY]
custom_preconds:
Prerequisite - Remote Config Setup for: Fan2Fan(Tesla) configuration
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "tesla_enabled" as needed to force display.** [ANDROID]
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.

BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)

(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform/target_audience)

NOTE: Making changes to the configuration may take a few minutes to propagate and/or require a few app restarts

GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (installed 12.11.0? or later)
AND User has verified their account
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game*

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the tesla_enabled configuration has been updated and published to 'true'
WHEN the user is on the Wallet Tab w/ ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the event information will contain The event date / time in the format (Ex. Sat, Jun 22 . 1:07 PM ET)
AND beneath the date time will be the Matchup Info displayed as Away Team @ Home Team
AND below the Matchup will be the Event's Venue
AND user is shown Wallet event card(s) WITHOUT attached button options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the native listview for the event is shown*
AND Sell Tickets CTA is shown (directs user to Sell Flow w/in SG - tesla)

*For TDC club

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the tesla_enabled configuration has been updated and published to 'false'
WHEN the user is on the Wallet Tab w/ ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the event information will contain The event date / time in the format (Ex. Sat, Jun 22 . 1:07 PM ET)
AND beneath the date time will be the Matchup Info displayed as Away Team @ Home Team
AND below the Matchup will be the Event's Venue
AND user is shown Wallet event card(s) WITH two attached button options
*Button one to read “Sell Tickets”
*Button two to read “Open Tickets”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the native listview for the event is shown*
AND Sell Tickets CTA is shown (directs user to Sell Flow w/in MPV - pinto)

*For TDC clubs

title: TESLA Configuration (Ticket Listview Support)  [iOS ONLY]
custom_preconds:
Prerequisite - Remote Config Setup for: Fan2Fan(Tesla) configuration
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "enable_pinto" as needed to force display.** [iOS]
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.

BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)

(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform/target_audience)

NOTE: Making changes to the configuration may take a few minutes to propagate and/or require a few app restarts

GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (installed 12.4.0 or later)
AND User has verified their account
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game*

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the enable_pinto configuration has been updated and published to 'false'
WHEN the user is on the Wallet Tab w/ ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the event information will contain The event date / time in the format (Ex. Sat, Jun 22 . 1:07 PM ET)
AND beneath the date time will be the Matchup Info displayed as Away Team @ Home Team
AND below the Matchup will be the Event's Venue
AND user is shown Wallet event card(s) WITHOUT attached button options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the native listview for the event is shown*
AND Sell Tickets CTA is shown (directs user to Sell Flow w/in SG - tesla)

*For TDC club

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the enable_pinto configuration has been updated and published to 'true'
WHEN the user is on the Wallet Tab w/ ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the event information will contain The event date / time in the format (Ex. Sat, Jun 22 . 1:07 PM ET)
AND beneath the date time will be the Matchup Info displayed as Away Team @ Home Team
AND below the Matchup will be the Event's Venue
AND user is shown Wallet event card(s) WITH two attached button options
*Button one to read “Sell Tickets”
*Button two to read “Open Tickets”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the native listview for the event is shown*
AND Sell Tickets CTA is shown (directs user to Sell Flow w/in MPV - pinto)

*For TDC clubs

title: Iconography
custom_preconds:
As we prepare to roll out Tesla flow to MLB ballpark users, we have new iconography that needs to be accommodated by the Android application so that the user understands the different icon types 

GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark 
AND User has verified their account
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game*

*TDC Club supported ONLY (TM clubs will NOT go through this flow)

FIGMA: [Icons](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=2774%3A51365&t=vw5WDGkr1lpyRY85-0)
Note: Testable in QA Environment only as of date (03/01/23) till box office enable supports in prod 
[BPA-6656](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6656)
[BP-10008](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10008)
custom_steps:
GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into the Ballpark application

GIVEN User has tickets that are forward able/ sellable
custom_expected:
![](index.php?/attachments/get/13429178)


NOTE: the sold tickets are no longer in the sellers Ballpark inventory

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user navigates to Wallet View (via Tickets Tab)
AND view the event card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown event card(s) (without 'Sell Ticket's button shown)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When user navigated to Ticket Listview of an event having different ticket states*

*navigation to listview can occur many way, may be best to validate entry to the listview from each.
Here are few known:
**HomeTab > NTE Event Card (above open tickets button)
**TicketsTab > WalletTab > Wallet Event Card
**TicketsTab > ViewAll > Event Entry
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown listview of the event
AND user should display with two buttons on the bottom of the screen

*one button to read "Sell Tickets"
*secondary button to read "Forward Tickets"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has tickets that are Ticket Forward accepted
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with radio button with Green Checkmark for forwarding

(Refer Screenshot attached in Expected Result)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has tickets that are Ticket Forward accept pending (or share link)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with radio button with Orange Arrow 

(Refer Screenshot attached in Expected Result)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has tickets with barcode unavailable (i.e embargoed)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with radio button with embargoed barcode image



(Refer Screenshot attached in Expected Result for Barcode unavailable)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has tickets that have been Scanned
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with radio button for Ticket Scanned 

(Refer Screenshot attached in Expected Result for Ticket Scanned)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has tickets that have been listed for sell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with radio button with Green Dollar Sign indicates ticket is currently listed on SG

(Refer Screenshot attached in Expected Result for Ticket Listed)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has tickets that not listed above (Forward Accepted, Forward pending, Barcode unavailable be, Ticket Scanned, Ticket Listed)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with barcode image (NOT the embargoed version) 

(Refer Screenshot attached in Expected Result for None of Above)

title: Ticket List View- Button Sell Tickets & Forward Tickets
custom_preconds:
As a Ballpark user, I want to know how to sell my game tickets in the Ballpark application so I don't take a loss on games I do not attend 

FIGMA: [TESLA](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=2774%3A51365&t=vw5WDGkr1lpyRY85-0)
[BPA-6657](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6657)
[BP-10009](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10009)
custom_steps:
GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into BP app [Android: 12.2.0 or Greater, iOS 12.3.0 or greater]

GIVEN User has verified their account via MLB.com 

GIVEN User has tickets that are eligible to be sold

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user on the ticket list view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with two buttons on the bottom of the screen
AND selection of “Sell Tickets” is only available if a user selects an eligible ticket via their ticket list view

*one button to read "Sell Tickets" 
*secondary button to read "Forward Tickets"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user select "Sell Tickets"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selection of "Sell Tickets" will display with a new view 
AND “Sell Tickets” is disabled until an eligible ticket is selected

*further validation of the Sell Modal are covered within
[SellModal](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/30226663&group_by=cases:section_id&group_id=1647339&group_order=asc)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user back navigates
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is returned to the list view of the event
AND user should display with two buttons on the bottom of the screen

*one button to read "Sell Tickets" 
*secondary button to read "Forward Tickets"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user select "Forward Tickets"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selection of "Forward Tickets" will display 
AND “Forward Tickets” is disabled until an eligible ticket is selected

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user back navigates
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is returned to the list view of the event
AND user should display with two buttons on the bottom of the screen

*one button to read "Sell Tickets" 
*secondary button to read "Forward Tickets"

title: Ticket List View - Sell Modal
custom_preconds:
As a Ballpark user, I want to know how to sell my game tickets in the Ballpark application so I don't take a loss on games I do not attend

FIGMA:[TESLA](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=2774%3A51365&t=vw5WDGkr1lpyRY85-0)

[BPA-6672](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6672)
[BP-10010](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10010)
custom_steps:
GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into BP app [Android: 12.2.0 or Greater, iOS 12.3.0 or greater]

GIVEN User has verified their account via MLB.com

GIVEN User has tickets that are eligible to be sold

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user on the ticket list view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with two buttons on the bottom of the screen

*one button to read "Sell Tickets"
*secondary button to read "Forward Tickets"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Sell Tickets button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selection of "Sell Tickets" will display with a new view 
AND 'Sell Tickets' button shown (default: disabled)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects ticket(s) to list for sell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the ticket(s) is selected
AND 'Sell Tickets' button is enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' with ticket(s) selected
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a prompt is shown:
Header - “Sell your tickets on SeatGeek” 

Body - “MLB will share your account & ticket details with SeatGeek for use per seatgeek.com/privacy. To manage your ticket, you must remove it from sale on SeatGeek.” 

Buttons: Cancel, Sell Ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user tap on Cancel CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN selection of "Cancel" will bring user back to Ticket sell view

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' with ticket(s) selected
AND user tap on Sell Ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selection of “Sell Ticket” will bring user to SeatGeek authentication screen

*[Log In Seatgeek](https://seatgeek.com/ambassador/login)
*Seatgeek authentication should be in a webview

[if an error is expected, then 'We experienced an error in processing the request. Please try again.' with OK cta is shown.]


Android: If ticket is not resellable THEN user will prompted with message before seatgeek authentication. 
These tickets are ineligible to be sold. Please make sure they are valid for resale.

title: Call to VAPI Endpoint*[requires Proxy]
custom_preconds:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6707

GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into BP app [Android: 12.11.0 or Greater, iOS 12.4.0 or greater]

GIVEN User has verified their account via MLB.com

GIVEN User has tickets that are eligible to be sold

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user navigates to Sell view (via Listview > Sell Tickets button)
AND user taps 'Sell Tickets' with ticket(s) selected
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a prompt is shown:
Header - “Sell Tickets on SeatGeek”

Body - “You are leaving the Ballpark app to list your tickets on SeatGeek. Please utilize the SeatGeek app to manage your ticket listing”

Buttons: Cancel, Sell Ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' within 'Sell Tickets on SeatGeek' prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is directed to SG page

AND there should be qabox office call which has VAPI endpoint should be generated for ticket selected with ticketID’s 

i.e. 
listing?ticketIDs=42591060@@108@@71642
listing?ticketIDs=43821019@@108@@71642
listing?ticketIDs=43821020@@108@@71642

*verify using Proxy tools (Charles or Proxyman)

title: Send Payload to Marketplace(SeatGeek) *[requires Proxy]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into BP app [Android: 12.11.0 or Greater, iOS 12.4.0 or greater]

GIVEN User has verified their account via MLB.com

GIVEN User has tickets that are eligible to be sold

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user on the ticket list view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with two buttons on the bottom of the screen

*one button to read "Sell Tickets"
*secondary button to read "Forward Tickets"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Sell Tickets button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selection of "Sell Tickets" will display with a new view
AND 'Sell Tickets' button shown (default: disabled)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects ticket(s) to list for sell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the ticket(s) is selected
AND 'Sell Tickets' button is enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' with ticket(s) selected
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a prompt is shown:
Header - “Sell Tickets on SeatGeek”

Body - “You are leaving the Ballpark app to list your tickets on SeatGeek. Please utilize the SeatGeek app to manage your ticket listing”

Buttons: Cancel, Sell Ticket

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' with ticket(s) selected
AND user tap on Sell Ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selection of “Sell Ticket” will bring user to SeatGeek authentication screen

*Log In Seatgeek
*Seatgeek authentication should be in a webview


iOS Only - [if an error is expected, then 'We experienced an error in processing the request. Please try again.' with OK cta is shown.]

AND there should be a call made to SG containing the appropriate payload - SG URL(env depenedent), mlb token(mlb-f2f-token), and client ID (ballpark-ios or ballpark-android)

*verify using Proxy tools (Charles or Proxyman)
i.e. Prod example: https://seatgeek.com/ambassador/login?mlb-f2f-token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpYXQiOjE2ODIwODU5MzgsImV4cCI6MTY4MzI5NTUzOCwidHMiOls0MjU5MTA1OV0sInBzIjpbMzc5ODJdLCJ0aWQiOjEwOCwidmkiOjF9.hL78o1qJZ93ewkQ0hDr-5urElKAkgj112GIE4k9r62s&client=ballpark-ios

i.e. QA example: https://mlb2.tixcast.com/api/webhooks/dc/mlb/sell?mlb-f2f-token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpYXQiOjE3MDAxNjAyNTEsImV4cCI6MTcwMDE2Mzg1MSwidHMiOls4OTg2MjkwOV0sInBzIjpbMTM4NTgxXSwidGlkIjoxNTgsInZpIjozMiwib2tpZCI6IjAwdXd1OXhkZ2hLbExCNTZCMGg3IiwiY2lkIjoiUFZTQiIsImVjYyI6IlJFR1VMQVIifQ.6ncL7h6EuyMsPLlR-SZ8uK3NMkLDTdQr1M0NvT33Qt8&client=ballpark-ios

title: Refresh ticket status after listing in Marketplace(SeatGeek) *[requires Proxy]
custom_preconds:
[BP-9728](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9728 )
[BPA-6816](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6816 )




GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into BP app [Android: 12.11.0 or Greater, iOS 12.4.0 or greater]

GIVEN User has verified their account via MLB.com

GIVEN User has tickets that are eligible to be sold

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user navigates to Sell view (via Listview > Sell Tickets button)
AND user taps 'Sell Tickets' with ticket(s) selected
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a prompt is shown:
Header - “Sell Tickets on SeatGeek”

Body - “You are leaving the Ballpark app to list your tickets on SeatGeek. Please utilize the SeatGeek app to manage your ticket listing”

Buttons: Cancel, Sell Ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' within 'Sell Tickets on SeatGeek' prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selection of “Sell Ticket” will bring user to SeatGeek authentication screen
AND the payload passed to SeatGeek

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user dismisses* the SG webview (without completing a ticket listing)

*[iOS] dismissing webview can be performed 2 different ways (and should have same behavior)
**via 'Close' tap
**via swiping the SG modal window down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is returned to the listview 
AND user should notice a refresh occur resulting with the status of all tickets unchanged

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user dismisses the SG webview (with completing a ticket listing)*

*in future, performing an actual listing may be performed -- but to validate client, proxy tool can be used to change response value 'currentlyOnMarketOffer' to true within qa.boxoffice.mlb.com call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is returned to the listview 
AND user should notice a refresh occur resulting with the status of all tickets unchanged EXCEPT any/all tickets that have been listed to be sold (response from boxoffice)

*verify using Proxy tools Charles or Proxyman 
i.e. change response value 'currentlyOnMarketOffer' to true within qa.boxoffice.mlb.com call for any ticket

title: Refresh ticket status after delisting in Marketplace(SeatGeek) - One Ticket(at least) listable
custom_preconds:
[BP-9728](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9728 )
[BPA-6816](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6816 )




GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into BP app [Android: 12.11.0 or Greater, iOS 12.4.0 or greater]

GIVEN User has verified their account via MLB.com

GIVEN User has tickets that are eligible to be sold 

GIVEN User has at least one ticket already listed*
*requires 'currentlyOnMarketOffer' to be true && 'resellable' to be false in BoxOffice request/response

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user navigates to Sell view (via Listview > Sell Tickets button)
AND user taps 'Sell Tickets' with ticket(s) selected
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a prompt is shown:
Header - “Sell Tickets on SeatGeek”

Body - “You are leaving the Ballpark app to list your tickets on SeatGeek. Please utilize the SeatGeek app to manage your ticket listing”

Buttons: Cancel, Sell Ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' within 'Sell Tickets on SeatGeek' prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selection of “Sell Ticket” will bring user to SeatGeek authentication screen
AND the payload passed to SeatGeek*'

*verify using Proxy tools (Charles or Proxyman) 
i.e. https://seatgeek.com/ambassador/login?token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpYXQiOjE2ODIwODU5MzgsImV4cCI6MTY4MzI5NTUzOCwidHMiOls0MjU5MTA1OV0sInBzIjpbMzc5ODJdLCJ0aWQiOjEwOCwidmkiOjF9.hL78o1qJZ93ewkQ0hDr-5urElKAkgj112GIE4k9r62s

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user dismisses* the SG webview (without completing a ticket delisting)

*[iOS] dismissing webview can be performed 2 different ways (and should have same behavior)
**via 'Close' tap
**via swiping the SG modal window down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is returned to the listview 
AND user should notice a refresh occur resulting with the status of all tickets unchanged

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user dismisses the SG webview (with completing a ticket delisting)*

*in future, performing an actual delisting may be performed -- but to validate client, proxy tool can be used to change response value 'currentlyOnMarketOffer' to false within qa.boxoffice.mlb.com call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is returned to the listview 
AND user should notice a refresh occur resulting with the status of all tickets unchanged EXCEPT any/all tickets that have been delisted from being sold (response from boxoffice)

*verify using Proxy tools Charles or Proxyman 
i.e. change response value 'currentlyOnMarketOffer' to false within qa.boxoffice.mlb.com call for any ticket
